intro: Alsinanthus ruscifolius, commonly known as the woolly phlox, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
